article.title: Delivery of increments
article.label: Incremental Delivery
article.intro: Read how we deliver the product in functional increments
article.description: Incremental delivery of software means that software product is specified, designed, implemented, tested and deployed in a number of builds. Each build has a new portion of functionality. All builds together constitute the project scope.
article.keywords: incremental delivery, software builds, iterations, traceability matrix,

text.p: Incremental delivery of software means that software product is specified, designed, implemented, tested and deployed in a number of builds. Each build has a new portion of functionality. All builds together constitute the project scope.
Consider the example development steps in a sample software project. Project statement is:
text.pre: System is an online database management tool where end-users can find information about real estate objects and post new ads.
text.p: This is a list of functional requirements in the SRS:

tr.td: End-user can initiate search by keyword, System shall display search result
End-user can post a new ad, System shall validate information and include new ad into database
End-user can scroll search result in paging mode, System shall display different pages with search result
Administrator can list users and block any, System shall display user list and delete selected users
Administrator can sort list of users, System shall sort according to selected sorting criteria

The example illustrates that each new Iteration gives you a new workable product, and serves as an extension to the previous build.

concepts.c1: Schedule is a coarse-grained project plan developed by the project manager
concepts.c2: Iteration is detailed project plan of one time frame
concepts.c3: Traceability Matrix is the spreadsheet with that tracks Functional Requirements
